    Define the Moran model. Describe briefly the infinite sites model of mutations.

    We henceforth consider a population with NNN individuals evolving according to the rules of the Moran model. In addition we assume:

    • the allelic type of any individual at any time lies in a given countable state space SSS;

    • individuals are subject to mutations at constant rate u=θ/Nu=\theta / Nu=θ/N, independently of the population dynamics;

    • each time a mutation occurs, if the allelic type of the individual was x∈Sx \in Sx∈S, it changes to y∈Sy \in Sy∈S with probability P(x,y)P(x, y)P(x,y), where P(x,y)P(x, y)P(x,y) is a given Markovian transition matrix on SSS that is symmetric:

    P(x,y)=P(y,x)(x,y∈S)P(x, y)=P(y, x) \quad(x, y \in S) P(x,y)=P(y,x)(x,y∈S)

    (i) Show that, if two individuals are sampled at random from the population at some time ttt, then the time to their most recent common ancestor has an exponential distribution, with a parameter that you should specify.

    (ii) Let Δ+1\Delta+1Δ+1 be the total number of mutations that accumulate on the two branches separating these individuals from their most recent common ancestor. Show that Δ+1\Delta+1Δ+1 is a geometric random variable, and specify its probability parameter ppp.

    (iii) The first individual is observed to be of type x∈Sx \in Sx∈S. Explain why the probability that the second individual is also of type xxx is

    P(XΔ=x∣X0=x),\mathbb{P}\left(X_{\Delta}=x \mid X_{0}=x\right), P(XΔ​=x∣X0​=x),

    where (Xn,n⩾0)\left(X_{n}, n \geqslant 0\right)(Xn​,n⩾0) is a Markov chain on SSS with transition matrix PPP and is independent of Δ\DeltaΔ.

    Part II, 2013

    Let (Xt,t⩾0)\left(X_{t}, t \geqslant 0\right)(Xt​,t⩾0) be a Markov chain on {0,1,…}\{0,1, \ldots\}{0,1,…} with QQQ-matrix given by
